Context: The Advanced French Patisserie postgraduate program is offered at George Brown College in collaboration with École Nationale Supérieure de Pâtisserie (ENSP) in France. Students will have the opportunity to work in top patisseries, bakeries, restaurants, and hotels in France as part of their studies. The program operates from Monday to Friday. Required courses for Semester 1 include HOSF 4021 - Advanced French Pastry – Theory & Practical (Part 1), HOSF 4025 - French Language, and HOSF 4027 - Gastronomy. In Semester 2, students will participate in an externship in France through HOSF 4032 and take Advanced French Pastry – Theory & Practical (Part 2 and Advanced French Patisserie II (IN FRANCE) - HOSF 4031. Students will have the opportunity to benefit from partnerships with employers and industry partners for work experience opportunities, as well as pursue self-directed industry work experience. Upon completion of the program, students will return to Canada with stronger skills, a richer understanding of local and sustainable ways of working, and international experience sought after by industry.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Advanced French Patisserie Program (Postgraduate) H413 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
Program Offered: Advanced French Pastry II (HOSF 4031), The Slow Food Experience (HOSF 1170), Patisserie Capstone (HOSF 4042), Art and Design (HOSF 4026)
Course Names: HOSF 4031 - Advanced French Pastry II, HOSF 1170 - The Slow Food Experience, HOSF 4042 - Patisserie Capstone, HOSF 4026 - Art and Design
Semester: Semester 3 for HOSF 4031, Unspecified for other courses
Program Learning Outcomes:
- Apply techniques such as reconstituting, revising, laminating and assembling to traditional French pastry and baking, using emerging trends in the French patisserie.
- Converse in basic French and use correct terminology within a food service operation.
- Identify the holistic practices in French gastronomy through field education and/or gastronomic theory.
- Prepare French pastries and baked goods within Canadian and EU health, safety and nutrition regulations, standards, guidelines and processes.
- Develop unique baking, pastry or confectionery product and manage the commercialization and marketing of that product.
- Manage the production, sales and business aspects of a personally created line of French pastries and baked goods.
Tuition & Fees:
Domestic Tuition: $16,370.00 (Fall 2023) or $16,370.00 * (Fall 2024 and later)
International Tuition: $36,445.00 (Fall 2024) or $36,445.00 ** (Fall 2023 and earlier)
Additional Costs:
- Uniform: $290
- Black safety shoes: $110 - $160
- Knives and small wares: $500–$700
- Airfare to France †: Unspecified

* Estimated total of tuition, ancillary fees, student service and materials (including accommodation at École Nationale Supérieure de Pâtisserie) for three semesters starting in Fall 2023 or Fall 2024.
** Estimated total of tuition, materials (including accommodation at École Nationale Supérieure de Pâtisserie), student service and ancillary fees for the first three semesters starting in Fall 2024.
† Accommodation at École Nationale Supérieure de Pâtisserie.

Context:
Program Fees and Costs:
- Knives and small wares: $500–$700
- Airfare to France (approximate): $1,400–$1,800
- OSAP funding approval for applicants meeting eligibility criteria

Program Admission Requirements:
- Diploma or bachelor's degree in baking, pastry arts or culinary management OR
  - One-year certificate in baking, pastry arts, patisserie apprenticeship AND minimum one-year relevant work experience (resumé and references required) OR
  - Diploma or bachelor's degree in an unrelated field AND minimum of one-year full-time relevant work experience (resumé and references required)
- English language proficiency test results or college assessment for international students with non-English transcripts

Additional Requirements:
- Valid WHMIS and Sanitation certification prior to program start

Application Information:
- Domestic students apply through Ontario Colleges
- International students apply through the George Brown College "How to Apply" page.
